text: The Idice is a river in the Tuscany and Emilia-Romagna regions of Italy. The source of the river is in the province of Florence near Monghidoro in the Appennino Tosco-Emiliano mountains. The river flows north into the province of Bologna near Monterenzio before being joined by the Savena east of Bologna. The river then curves eastward and flows near Castenaso and Budrio before flowing into the province of Ferrara. It then flows into the Reno near where the Sillaro enters the Reno southeast of Argenta. ==References== Category:Rivers of the Province of Florence Category:Rivers of the Province of Bologna Category:Rivers of the Province of Ferrara Category:Rivers of the Apennines Category:Rivers of Italy
